audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization of marketing/customer engagement processes. 37% lift in repeat purchases demonstrates measurable improvement in customer retention function. Pattern is replicable across retail organizations with loyalty programs.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (Starbucks), specific quantified metric (37% lift), though source attribution could be stronger ('across various reports' suggests compilation rather than primary source).

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization of inventory management process. 75% time reduction (60 min to 15 min) is significant efficiency gain. Highly replicable pattern across retail operations.

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. Most claims describe functional optimization (marketing, inventory, customer service) rather than business model transformation. Claims C5 and C6 are borderline and could benefit from more specific context to confirm they're not tier 1 business expansion.
